subject: Fix tox.ini parse error with tox 4.2.8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-12 03:26:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix tox.ini parse error with tox 4.2.8

The validation of setenv in the recent tox like 4.2.8 seems more strict.
We need a space between a factor and envvar.

Note that we need to discuss the three variants of PYTHONWARNINGS
but this commit focuses on fixing the gate failure due to tox.ini.

Change-Id: I13be2d39850e77f15e5bbf67b0022b10b09e5c6f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tox.ini parse error with tox 4.2.8

The validation of setenv in the recent tox like 4.2.8 seems more strict.
We need a space between a factor and envvar.

Note that we need to discuss the three variants of PYTHONWARNINGS
but this commit focuses on fixing the gate failure due to tox.ini.

Change-Id: I13be2d39850e77f15e5bbf67b0022b10b09e5c6f

subject: Fix mount's systemd unit dependency logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-12 14:29:27.000000000', 'files': ['templates/systemd-mount.j2'], 'message': "Fix mount's systemd unit dependency logic

Improve logic for making systemd mount dependent on
network-online.target when network filesystem is being used.

This change improves feature implemented in commit [1].

Currently when device is specified by UUID or LABEL, dependency for
network-online.target is added even it's not a network filesystem.
We should be careful with this as it may create circular dependency.
In my case, circular dependency looked like this:

network.target ->
  network-pre.target ->
    netfilter-persistent.service ->
      local-fs.target ->
        var-lib-nova.mount ->
          network-online.target ->
            network.target

Additionally, this commit was originally supposed to add dependency also
for CIFS mounts(these ones starting from '//') but it never worked in my
opinion. It was also fixed by this change.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_mount/commit/6a9dcb688628a1a3900f25f72effce4f62f6900e

Change-Id: I5d2d9c074aa0390a6f8b7c8c0ba1c839fe26f6c5
(cherry picked from commit 480bb0c871848f2c65f6c7312eab77c33b88ee7a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mount's systemd unit dependency logic

Improve logic for making systemd mount dependent on
network-online.target when network filesystem is being used.

This change improves feature implemented in commit [1].

Currently when device is specified by UUID or LABEL, dependency for
network-online.target is added even it's not a network filesystem.
We should be careful with this as it may create circular dependency.
In my case, circular dependency looked like this:

network.target ->
  network-pre.target ->
    netfilter-persistent.service ->
      local-fs.target ->
        var-lib-nova.mount ->
          network-online.target ->
            network.target

Additionally, this commit was originally supposed to add dependency also
for CIFS mounts(these ones starting from '//') but it never worked in my
opinion. It was also fixed by this change.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_mount/commit/6a9dcb688628a1a3900f25f72effce4f62f6900e

Change-Id: I5d2d9c074aa0390a6f8b7c8c0ba1c839fe26f6c5
(cherry picked from commit 480bb0c871848f2c65f6c7312eab77c33b88ee7a)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}, {'_account_id': 35491, 'name': 'Roberto Alfieri', 'display_name': 'Roberto Alfieri', 'email': 'ralfieri@redhat.com', 'username': 'ralfieri'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 39, 'created': '2023-01-11 10:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['roles/external-data-plane-management/templates/deploy_compute.sh.j2', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/install_required_packages.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/templates/validate_edpm.sh.j2', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/README.md', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/meta/main.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/prepare_node.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/generate_tripleo_standalone_vars.yml', 'roles/external-data-plane-management/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/validate_edpm.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/templates/compute-parameter.yaml.j2', 'playbooks/deploy-standalone-compute.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/compute_services_on_target_host.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/tasks/deploy_standalone.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/templates/deploy_compute.sh.j2', 'roles/external-data-plane-management/tasks/compute_services_on_target_host.yml', 'roles/external_data_plane_management/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Refactor EDPM job

This patch looks huge, so let's split things in the following listing:

- rename role to match the naming convention
  - role name shouldn't get hyphen, so let's use underscores instead.
    Playbooks don't need to follow this rule.

This should make the role more portable in the future.

- modify role
  - "disable" the main.yml - we must call specific task file.
  - no more condioned deploy based on variables. Makes it easier to
    follow and maintain.
  - update how the edpm inventory is edited
    - use plain YAML
    - output plain YAML
    - this format is consistent with latest changes in tripleo-ansible[1]

These changes make the overall role easier to understand and maintain,
while ensuring the playbook is also easier to read. It may also make the
deploy a bit faster with the new way to run the various tasks.

- update playbook
  - boostrap both nodes in a 2-stages way (check comment as to why).
  - deploy compute from the undercloud (mimic what an operator would do)
  - validate the compute from the undercloud (no actual change here)
  - target specific task_file during the different stages. It's easier
    to understand what's going on in there

These changes should allow a better understanding of the overall playbook.

- update edpm deploy script to use an environment file instead of CLI
  params
  - this makes the script lighter and easier to understand
  - adding new parameters in the env file is easier
  - reading the env file for debugging is better

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/869357

Change-Id: I263f424a5a08214b9c46c5ea73b6b428709ad47b
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor EDPM job

This patch looks huge, so let's split things in the following listing:

- rename role to match the naming convention
  - role name shouldn't get hyphen, so let's use underscores instead.
    Playbooks don't need to follow this rule.

This should make the role more portable in the future.

- modify role
  - "disable" the main.yml - we must call specific task file.
  - no more condioned deploy based on variables. Makes it easier to
    follow and maintain.
  - update how the edpm inventory is edited
    - use plain YAML
    - output plain YAML
    - this format is consistent with latest changes in tripleo-ansible[1]

These changes make the overall role easier to understand and maintain,
while ensuring the playbook is also easier to read. It may also make the
deploy a bit faster with the new way to run the various tasks.

- update playbook
  - boostrap both nodes in a 2-stages way (check comment as to why).
  - deploy compute from the undercloud (mimic what an operator would do)
  - validate the compute from the undercloud (no actual change here)
  - target specific task_file during the different stages. It's easier
    to understand what's going on in there

These changes should allow a better understanding of the overall playbook.

- update edpm deploy script to use an environment file instead of CLI
  params
  - this makes the script lighter and easier to understand
  - adding new parameters in the env file is easier
  - reading the env file for debugging is better

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/869357

Change-Id: I263f424a5a08214b9c46c5ea73b6b428709ad47b

subject: Pin tox to < 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-01-09 19:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Id89f30a1dd57053d43f2d994eedc3f941fc78ae6
"}]
commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Id89f30a1dd57053d43f2d994eedc3f941fc78ae6

Added sorting and marker for pagination of actions

This solves the sorting and marker for pagination
when listing actions.

subject: [microk8s-cloud] support strict confinement for snaps
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2023-01-13 06:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/zaza-smoke-test.yaml', 'playbooks/charmbuild.yaml', 'playbooks/collect-run-data.yaml', 'roles/microk8s-cloud/tasks/main.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': '[microk8s-cloud] support strict confinement for snaps

Parameterize microk8s snap installation to choose
channel and confinement.
In case of strict confinement, change the group
and escalate the privileges to run microk8s command.

Ensure ~/.local/share directory exists that allows
running juju commands in strict confinement mode.

Fix linting issues.

Change-Id: Iba52349df9c6d077cd33a4786359fc2d54182068
'}]
commit_message:
[microk8s-cloud] support strict confinement for snaps

Parameterize microk8s snap installation to choose
channel and confinement.
In case of strict confinement, change the group
and escalate the privileges to run microk8s command.

Ensure ~/.local/share directory exists that allows
running juju commands in strict confinement mode.

Fix linting issues.

Change-Id: Iba52349df9c6d077cd33a4786359fc2d54182068

subject: Pin tox<4 for stable branches testing
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2023-01-10 12:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.d/nodejs-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Pin tox<4 for stable branches testing

horizon npm jobs start failing due to some recent changes in tox4.
As discussed on open-discuss ML, it is decided to keep testing the
stable branch with the tox version that they release with and not
with the tox 4. This patch set the 'ensure_tox_version' to use 4,
which will tell zuul to install tox<4 if it's not present.
For more info. please refer [1].

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-January/031668.html

Change-Id: I3652d87d817030bcd3855d26bfa41b8b7061d08e
"}]
commit_message:
Pin tox<4 for stable branches testing

horizon npm jobs start failing due to some recent changes in tox4.
As discussed on open-discuss ML, it is decided to keep testing the
stable branch with the tox version that they release with and not
with the tox 4. This patch set the 'ensure_tox_version' to use 4,
which will tell zuul to install tox<4 if it's not present.
For more info. please refer [1].

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-January/031668.html

Change-Id: I3652d87d817030bcd3855d26bfa41b8b7061d08e

subject: Add force_down nova-compute service to DisableComputeServiceTask
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-13 06:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/host_failure.py', 'masakari/compute/nova.py'], 'message': 'Add force_down nova-compute service to DisableComputeServiceTask

In scenario when host reboot unexpectedly because of hardware
failure, nova-compute become UP again after period of time,
so some of instance evacuation at that time goes to ERROR state.

To prevent this scenario happen, force_down nova-compute service
in DisableComputeServiceTask before instance evacuation started
to ensure that, all of instances can evacuate successfully.

Change-Id: I72f7c0418746dd23f3126e543d5cfeef23a1a2a1
'}]
commit_message:
Add force_down nova-compute service to DisableComputeServiceTask

In scenario when host reboot unexpectedly because of hardware
failure, nova-compute become UP again after period of time,
so some of instance evacuation at that time goes to ERROR state.

To prevent this scenario happen, force_down nova-compute service
in DisableComputeServiceTask before instance evacuation started
to ensure that, all of instances can evacuate successfully.

Change-Id: I72f7c0418746dd23f3126e543d5cfeef23a1a2a1

commit_message:
Pin stable branch jobs nodeset to Ubuntu Focal (20.04)

In 2023.1 cycle. we are moving the default distro
version of Ubuntu to Jammy (22.04)[1] so we need to pin
the nodeset for stable branch job in master gate so that
they continue run on their supporting distro version which is
Ubuntu Focal since stable/victoria.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-ci-jobs-to-ubuntu-jammy.html

Change-Id: I20e9be1071c27301a07089ec70c9ceb53fca7633

subject: Avoid rbac defaults conflict in functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-01-09 18:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['placement/tests/functional/fixtures/placement.py'], 'message': 'Avoid rbac defaults conflict in functional tests

RBAC defaults for enforce_scope and enforce_new_defaults for
placement service is False. Nova is setting them for Nova service
to True in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/866218

Placement tests fixture are used in Nova functional tests and
setting the rbac defaults causing placement to run with defaults
of what Nova is setting. To avoid this conflict, in placement
tests fixture, we need to set enforce_scope and enforce_new_defaults
to the same value it is for placement service.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/866218
Change-Id: I7e94d107962efdd7779733375327f5c8248c7087
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid rbac defaults conflict in functional tests

RBAC defaults for enforce_scope and enforce_new_defaults for
placement service is False. Nova is setting them for Nova service
to True in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/866218

Placement tests fixture are used in Nova functional tests and
setting the rbac defaults causing placement to run with defaults
of what Nova is setting. To avoid this conflict, in placement
tests fixture, we need to set enforce_scope and enforce_new_defaults
to the same value it is for placement service.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/866218
Change-Id: I7e94d107962efdd7779733375327f5c8248c7087

subject: Pin tox to < 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-09 19:08:11.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Ic10e24c1360dc3215f9e94de4f475c6cb2005ef4
"}]
commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Ic10e24c1360dc3215f9e94de4f475c6cb2005ef4

commit_message:

subject: Boolean options: use strict checking
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-11-14 16:31:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/cli/property-keys.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/boolean-properties-strict-checking-bdd624b5da81e723.yaml', 'glanceclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Boolean options: use strict checking

Boolean options (such as "--protected" for glance md-namespace-update)
should accept a limited amount of valid values, rather than assuming an
"invalid" value means "False".

The following values (no matter the case) will now be interpreted as
True: âtâ,âtrueâ, âonâ, âyâ, âyesâ, or â1â.

The following values (no matter the case) will now be interpreted as
False: âfâ, âfalseâ, âoffâ, ânâ, ânoâ, or â0â.

Change-Id: I0e7942045d883ac398bab4a7a85f2b4ac9b1ed8c
Closes-Bug: #1607317
'}]
commit_message:
Boolean options: use strict checking

Boolean options (such as "--protected" for glance md-namespace-update)
should accept a limited amount of valid values, rather than assuming an
"invalid" value means "False".

The following values (no matter the case) will now be interpreted as
True: âtâ,âtrueâ, âonâ, âyâ, âyesâ, or â1â.

The following values (no matter the case) will now be interpreted as
False: âfâ, âfalseâ, âoffâ, ânâ, ânoâ, or â0â.

Change-Id: I0e7942045d883ac398bab4a7a85f2b4ac9b1ed8c
Closes-Bug: #1607317

subject: Fix dict object key error when haproxy interfaces not defined
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-11 22:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['templates/service.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': "Fix dict object key error when haproxy interfaces not defined

The ternary options appear to be getting evaluated whether they
are used or not, so item['interface'] is always accessed.

This patch aims to check for the key's presence before performing
ternary operations, or use Ansible variables to postpone evaluation
until absolutely necessary.

Change-Id: Ib1462c04d1a0820a37998f989e2ed16566f71f54
(cherry picked from commit 445b15f9c3776d8f88102934395076f92edfdb25)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dict object key error when haproxy interfaces not defined

The ternary options appear to be getting evaluated whether they
are used or not, so item['interface'] is always accessed.

This patch aims to check for the key's presence before performing
ternary operations, or use Ansible variables to postpone evaluation
until absolutely necessary.

Change-Id: Ib1462c04d1a0820a37998f989e2ed16566f71f54
(cherry picked from commit 445b15f9c3776d8f88102934395076f92edfdb25)

commit_message:
Ensure tar is installed on LXC host

Tar is required for LXC to create base container using lxc-create. When
it's absent lxc-create exits with code 1 without any output on this
task [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/src/commit/ef721dbf13db8f3578b45791ac67c4815bd8c59a/tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml#L71

commit_message:
Fix pxe image lookups

Image lookups in the PXE interface, for anaconda specific code,
were previously hard coded to try and invoke use of glance if
needed.

Except, not everything is glance.

commit_message:
Remove deleted projects from flavor access list

Previously Nova was unable to remove deleted projects from flavor's
access lists. This patch lifts described limitation and improves
logic of nova/api/openstack/identity.py library by introducing two
separate kinds of exceptions:

- webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError is raised when Keystone identity
  service version 3.0 was not found.
- webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest is raised when specified project is not
  found.

Closes-bug: #1980845
Change-Id: Icbf3bdd944f9a6c38f25ddea0b521ca48ee87a7f

commit_message:
Adding fallback mechanism to ntp validation role

It the 'chrony_enabled' key isn't found by hiera, the validation
will now proceed as if it was disabled. This should allow for successful
run on clouds with mix of ntp implementations.

Resolves: rhbz#2156049

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic9860b3531639e85926f5221cd9c5cde03eecfa8
(cherry picked from commit 726898e1e179b4616e2079e428d38bea42c3428b)

commit_message:
Set gcomm_cipher to an appropriate value if FIPS is enabled

The default cipher set via puppet-tripleo is AES128-SHA256 for mysql
and this is not allowed in FIPS.
This commit overrides this value to be 'ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384'
if FIPS is enabled.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/868782
Change-Id: I386ce0d7459cc9750172849215440cd532fb2618
(cherry picked from commit 070bc335b66e2cd195fc3e011705e052be4f4667)

commit_message:

commit_message:
Add typing information and documentation

Tools like mypy and IDEs like PyCharm use this kind of information in
order to do type checking and to provide better auto-completion, which
can be an enormous help for developers.

Type hints are supported since Python 3.5. [1]
Variable annotations are supported since Python 3.6. [2]

[1]: https://peps.python.org/pep-0484/
[2]: https://peps.python.org/pep-0526/

Change-Id: I00834257335baa070e81ee4418d9314065db289c

commit_message:
Allow overriding mysql_bundle::gcomm_cipher

There are cases where it is necessary to change the default cipher
used by galera (example: FIPS).
This commit adds a new parameter called MysqlGaleraSSLCipher to
easily override the default value 'AES128-SHA256' if required.

Change-Id: I7f47741d4b2a5a3473d24439689cc358bf7738f0
(cherry picked from commit 7c600ad224f80003bed683e850e9a76db5e539e7)

commit_message:
Support role specific ContainerImagePrepare

This is the last change of the series of changes to implements partial
support for overriding the ContainerImaePrepare parameter for
individual roles, so that users can use different set of images for
each role.

example:
parameter_defaults:
  ContainerImagePrepare:
    - push_destination: true
      set:
        name_prefix: openstack-
        name_suffix: ''
        namespace: quay.io/repository/tripleowallabycentos9
        ...
  ComputeEl8ContainerImagePrepare:
    - push_destination: true
      set:
        name_prefix: openstack-
        name_suffix: ''
        namespace: quay.io/repository/tripleowallabycentos8
        ...

This change makes the deployment command to generate the image
parameters in tht according to these layered definitions.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/utils.py

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/860315
Change-Id: I76f78a12f6b4b0763a47e85f38f743da6269a47e
(cherry picked from commit 0479d72909b80c0d9dec07c6a83706366600a63d)

commit_message:
Handle omitted variables which appear as empty strings

Changes to external roles cause some variables to be passed in
as empty strings which result in invalid config and InvalidArgument
errors.

This could be addressed here or in the calling role.

subject: Ensure FIP to VIP association is not lost on re-sync
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-12 14:13:57.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/ovn_bgp_driver.py', 'ovn_bgp_agent/tests/unit/drivers/openstack/test_ovn_bgp_driver.py'], 'message': "Ensure FIP to VIP association is not lost on re-sync

When the VM that has a FIP associated is not using dhcp to get
its IP, the mac entry on the port_binding table is set to
['unknown']. This made the resync to fail on the mac checking
and therefore remove the exposed FIP routes.

This patch checks if the macs is unknown and it is a IP on the
tenant networks. If that is the case we don't check the format
of the mac and call expose_ip with empty IPs, as the IP to expose
in this case is the FIP that will be obtained at the expose_ip
method anyway.

Change-Id: Icdfc1cdc8b759181de3509cd5ddda330270fa6dc
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure FIP to VIP association is not lost on re-sync

When the VM that has a FIP associated is not using dhcp to get
its IP, the mac entry on the port_binding table is set to
['unknown']. This made the resync to fail on the mac checking
and therefore remove the exposed FIP routes.

This patch checks if the macs is unknown and it is a IP on the
tenant networks. If that is the case we don't check the format
of the mac and call expose_ip with empty IPs, as the IP to expose
in this case is the FIP that will be obtained at the expose_ip
method anyway.

Change-Id: Icdfc1cdc8b759181de3509cd5ddda330270fa6dc

subject: Add some information and VRF configuration on start up
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-11 07:28:57.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_bgp_agent/drivers/openstack/ovn_bgp_driver.py'], 'message': "Add some information and VRF configuration on start up

These actions were carried out during the sync phase. However
the VRF configuration can be perform on the start up phase and
probably won't change at all over time. We added some info logs
about it, and left the actions also at the sync function in case
they are manually changed/deleted by mistake -- as a reconcile
action

Change-Id: Ic39014b0e86ef2ed7b9cfc33d034c79cc150e7c0
"}]
commit_message:
Add some information and VRF configuration on start up

These actions were carried out during the sync phase. However
the VRF configuration can be perform on the start up phase and
probably won't change at all over time. We added some info logs
about it, and left the actions also at the sync function in case
they are manually changed/deleted by mistake -- as a reconcile
action

Change-Id: Ic39014b0e86ef2ed7b9cfc33d034c79cc150e7c0

commit_message:
Remove allow_overlapping_ips configuration option

This option was removed from Neutron in the Zed release [1]. This can be
backported to Yoga where the default value was changed to True [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/837286
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/807848

subject: Adds a wrapper script to run ovs-vsctl commands in the container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-22 20:32:59.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/openvswitch/templates/ovs-vsctl.j2', 'doc/source/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.rst', 'ansible/roles/openvswitch/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/openvswitch/defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/adds-ovs-vsctl-wrapper-da3dbbb19d5cc6f5.yaml'], 'message': 'Adds a wrapper script to run ovs-vsctl commands in the container

Libvirt needs to be able to plug ports into openvswitch bridges.
It does this using the ovs-vsctl command, which it searches for
in $PATH[1, 2]. This change will optionally install a wrapper
script that executes the ovs-vsctl commands in the context of the
openvswitchd container. This is useful when running libvirt on the
host whilst still running openvswitch in a container. The advantage
of this method over install the packages on the host is that it
ensures client compatability with the daemon. The default is set
to false as the wrapper could overwrite ovs-vsctl installed on the
host.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/ee51ab86c2e52b6ff1b17a4c7ad11439fd610c9e/src/util/virnetdevopenvswitch.c#L59
[2] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/a89b17c2a75cfbaeb9e430f88e0f8a7475eb4f54/docs/kbase/internals/command.rst#id3

Closes-Bug: #1995409
Change-Id: Iaa6bfb012ae847f5f6aa0a1fc1c27970ac265f93
(cherry picked from commit a82443481e17edecda728f8698f8b401ec910546)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a wrapper script to run ovs-vsctl commands in the container

Libvirt needs to be able to plug ports into openvswitch bridges.
It does this using the ovs-vsctl command, which it searches for
in $PATH[1, 2]. This change will optionally install a wrapper
script that executes the ovs-vsctl commands in the context of the
openvswitchd container. This is useful when running libvirt on the
host whilst still running openvswitch in a container. The advantage
of this method over install the packages on the host is that it
ensures client compatability with the daemon. The default is set
to false as the wrapper could overwrite ovs-vsctl installed on the
host.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/ee51ab86c2e52b6ff1b17a4c7ad11439fd610c9e/src/util/virnetdevopenvswitch.c#L59
[2] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/a89b17c2a75cfbaeb9e430f88e0f8a7475eb4f54/docs/kbase/internals/command.rst#id3

Closes-Bug: #1995409
Change-Id: Iaa6bfb012ae847f5f6aa0a1fc1c27970ac265f93
(cherry picked from commit a82443481e17edecda728f8698f8b401ec910546)

commit_message:
Fix some neutron configuration options

Move metadata_workers from neutron.conf to metadata_agent.ini.

Remove unknown option placement/os_region_name: we already have
placement/region_name which is the correct one.

This can be backported to previous releases.

Change-Id: I710b5364244d976020656e1ee68e89f337cb3086
(cherry picked from commit 92d6e27c5e7c83d7c2cacbe4c83be37dd84aa4ca)

commit_message:
Explicitly set the value of heartbeat_in_pthread

The ``[oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread`` config option
is set to ``true`` for wsgi applications to allow the RabbitMQ
heartbeats to function. For non-wsgi applications it is set to ``false``
as it may otherwise break the service [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/zed.html#upgrade-notes

Closes-Bug: #2002330

Change-Id: Id89bd6158aff42d59040674308a8672c358ccb3c
(cherry picked from commit 8b8b4a82177f072849c035c41de3776487ae8561)

commit_message:
Explicitly set the value of heartbeat_in_pthread

The ``[oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread`` config option
is set to ``true`` for wsgi applications to allow the RabbitMQ
heartbeats to function. For non-wsgi applications it is set to ``false``
as it may otherwise break the service [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/zed.html#upgrade-notes

Closes-Bug: #2002330

Change-Id: Id89bd6158aff42d59040674308a8672c358ccb3c
(cherry picked from commit 8b8b4a82177f072849c035c41de3776487ae8561)

commit_message:
Explicitly set the value of heartbeat_in_pthread

The ``[oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread`` config option
is set to ``true`` for wsgi applications to allow the RabbitMQ
heartbeats to function. For non-wsgi applications it is set to ``false``
as it may otherwise break the service [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/zed.html#upgrade-notes

Closes-Bug: #2002330

Change-Id: Id89bd6158aff42d59040674308a8672c358ccb3c
(cherry picked from commit 8b8b4a82177f072849c035c41de3776487ae8561)

commit_message:
Explicitly set the value of heartbeat_in_pthread

The ``[oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread`` config option
is set to ``true`` for wsgi applications to allow the RabbitMQ
heartbeats to function. For non-wsgi applications it is set to ``false``
as it may otherwise break the service [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/zed.html#upgrade-notes

Closes-Bug: #2002330

Change-Id: Id89bd6158aff42d59040674308a8672c358ccb3c
(cherry picked from commit 8b8b4a82177f072849c035c41de3776487ae8561)

subject: Update envlist for tox4
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-12 11:09:02.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update envlist for tox4

tox4 even when running specific env with -e option tries
to find python version for all envs defined in envlist[1]
when running with --skip-missing-interpreters=false and
fails if interpreter missing for any of the env.

With py38 in envlist it tries to find python3.8
which is not available in ubuntu-jammy by default
and fails, hence use generic version instead i.e py3
to handle it.

Once [1] is fixed we can update the list as per
default supported py3 version for a release.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/2811

Change-Id: I0559fcb1aa3d2c8800c1b9ea04e227dbf246c225
'}]
commit_message:
Update envlist for tox4

tox4 even when running specific env with -e option tries
to find python version for all envs defined in envlist[1]
when running with --skip-missing-interpreters=false and
fails if interpreter missing for any of the env.

With py38 in envlist it tries to find python3.8
which is not available in ubuntu-jammy by default
and fails, hence use generic version instead i.e py3
to handle it.

Once [1] is fixed we can update the list as per
default supported py3 version for a release.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/2811

Change-Id: I0559fcb1aa3d2c8800c1b9ea04e227dbf246c225

tox4: Add ignore_basepython_conflict = True to tox.ini

With latest tox (>4.0.15) python version conflicted with base
python. Adding ignore_basepython_conflict = True solves this
issue.

commit_message:
Fix tox4 error

tox.ini started failing with Tox4 which had some
incompatible changes. One of them is due to the
skipsdist = True.

This also adds setup-vault-env.sh to allowlist_externals, since it
fails otherwise.

Change-Id: If0ace2c2ef0915d9a4ffcba99d664ffe97621b12

subject: ARM64 nodes : rename larger types to be more descriptive
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-12-22 22:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nl03.opendev.org.yaml'], 'message': "ARM64 nodes : rename larger types to be more descriptive

AFAIK (and AFAICS from codesearch) nothing has ever been committed
that uses these larger node types.  IIRC they have been added for
testing various ways of getting devstack up, but that work isn't live
yet.

Now we are starting another Linaro ARM64 cloud, the names don't make
much sense with the flavors.

Move these to more descriptive names, that reflect the resources being
provided.

Change-Id: Ib7fa85437195c53c3cafc88b04385ef65333cfd5
"}]
commit_message:
ARM64 nodes : rename larger types to be more descriptive

AFAIK (and AFAICS from codesearch) nothing has ever been committed
that uses these larger node types.  IIRC they have been added for
testing various ways of getting devstack up, but that work isn't live
yet.

Now we are starting another Linaro ARM64 cloud, the names don't make
much sense with the flavors.

Move these to more descriptive names, that reflect the resources being
provided.

Change-Id: Ib7fa85437195c53c3cafc88b04385ef65333cfd5

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to work with 4.0

With tox release of 4.0, some parameters were deprecated and are ignored now
which causes tox failures. One of the most spread issues we have is using
`whitelist_externals` isntead of `allowlist_externals`


Change-Id: Ib9853f84d89aa55d2bdead548345dd89d43d98af
(cherry picked from commit ce9441a3642c5535bb6af6d86c59fffb22c58e47)

commit_message:
ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  feaâ
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

The value is set to 60 seconds by default as described in
"OVN issues in the field".

https://www.openvswitch.org/support/ovscon2019/day1/1436-OVSCON-Nouman.pdf
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405
(cherry picked from commit 491b8fb49a979cd2b08cc3f2871d6f234bf2de57)

commit_message:
ovn: add ovn-monitor-all variable

Setting ovn-monitor-all to 'true' will configure
ovn-controller to monitor all OVS database records
unconditionally. That will release some CPU resource
from OVS Southbound DB but will increase number of events
coming to ovn-controller.

Default value is 'false'.

subject: Retry on iDRAC SYS518 errors for all requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-02 07:48:21.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/connector.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-retry_volume_operation-on_sys518-009f2b16e5c38a27.yaml', 'sushy/tests/unit/test_connector.py'], 'message': 'Retry on iDRAC SYS518 errors for all requests

When iDRAC is still loading, some of the components is not available
for short period of time and returns HTTP 500 error with SYS518 error
code and message "iDRAC is currently unable to display any information
because data sources are unavailable.". There is already retry on GET
errors with Server side error, but this can happen also for other
requests, for example, DELETE.
This patch adds retry for all SYS518 failures disregarding request
method. This helps to fix a known intermittent issue when deleting
set of volumes one after another and iDRAC is reloading after
deleting each volume.

Co-Authored-By: Swapnil Machikar <swapnil.machikar@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: Ief49157438813c650fdd34d60dfe7ea8ea2d1702
(cherry picked from commit 2b760a6c9ef23ca2a9f736ca6a6c8c146490f1c3)

commit_message:
Retry on iDRAC SYS518 errors for all requests

When iDRAC is still loading, some of the components is not available
for short period of time and returns HTTP 500 error with SYS518 error
code and message "iDRAC is currently unable to display any information
because data sources are unavailable.". There is already retry on GET
errors with Server side error, but this can happen also for other
requests, for example, DELETE.
This patch adds retry for all SYS518 failures disregarding request
method. This helps to fix a known intermittent issue when deleting
set of volumes one after another and iDRAC is reloading after
deleting each volume.

Co-Authored-By: Swapnil Machikar <swapnil.machikar@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: Ief49157438813c650fdd34d60dfe7ea8ea2d1702
(cherry picked from commit 2b760a6c9ef23ca2a9f736ca6a6c8c146490f1c3)

commit_message:
Retry on iDRAC SYS518 errors for all requests

When iDRAC is still loading, some of the components is not available
for short period of time and returns HTTP 500 error with SYS518 error
code and message "iDRAC is currently unable to display any information
because data sources are unavailable.". There is already retry on GET
errors with Server side error, but this can happen also for other
requests, for example, DELETE.
This patch adds retry for all SYS518 failures disregarding request
method. This helps to fix a known intermittent issue when deleting
set of volumes one after another and iDRAC is reloading after
deleting each volume.

Co-Authored-By: Swapnil Machikar <swapnil.machikar@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: Ief49157438813c650fdd34d60dfe7ea8ea2d1702

commit_message:
Add stable/zed jobs on master gate

As zed is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

commit_message:
Set nohz_full in cpu-pinning element

nohz_full (or full dynticks) is a Linux kernel setting that should reduce
kernel noise on configured CPUs to a minimum. This change activates this
setting on all vCPUs except the first one.

Change-Id: Ie009aff52d572873da0bb5cc43fedd7f3325dccc

commit_message:
Handle omitted variables which appear as empty strings

Changes to external roles cause some variables to be passed in
as empty strings which result in invalid config and InvalidArgument
errors.

subject: Add cpu-pinning element
revisions:
[{'number': 44, 'created': '2022-12-08 10:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cpu-pinning/static/etc/tuned/amphora/tuned.conf', 'elements/cpu-pinning/svc-map', 'elements/cpu-pinning/README.rst', 'elements/cpu-pinning/static/etc/tuned/amphora/script.sh', 'diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh', 'elements/cpu-pinning/post-install.d/30-set-tuned-profile', 'elements/cpu-pinning/post-install.d/20-enable-tuned', 'diskimage-create/README.rst', 'elements/cpu-pinning/environment.d/80-kernel-cpu-affinity', 'elements/cpu-pinning/package-installs.yaml', 'elements/cpu-pinning/element-deps', 'elements/cpu-pinning/static/etc/tuned/active_profile', 'releasenotes/notes/add-cpu-pinning-element-86617303b720d5a9.yaml'], 'message': 'Add cpu-pinning element

The new "cpu-pinning" element optimizes the amphora image for better
vertical scaling. When an amphora flavor with multiple vCPUs is
configured it will configure the kernel to isolate (isolcpus)
all vCPUs except the first one.
Furthermore, it uninstalls irqbalance and sets the IRQ affinity to the
first CPU. That way the other CPUs are free to be used by HAProxy
exclusively. A new customized TuneD profile applies some more tweaks
for improving network latency.

This new feature is disabled by default in diskimage-create.sh.

Story: 2010236
Task: 46042
Change-Id: I1a0591de79be867483a044705e866b2368b2a567
'}]
commit_message:
Add cpu-pinning element

The new "cpu-pinning" element optimizes the amphora image for better
vertical scaling. When an amphora flavor with multiple vCPUs is
configured it will configure the kernel to isolate (isolcpus)
all vCPUs except the first one.
Furthermore, it uninstalls irqbalance and sets the IRQ affinity to the
first CPU. That way the other CPUs are free to be used by HAProxy
exclusively. A new customized TuneD profile applies some more tweaks
for improving network latency.

This new feature is disabled by default in diskimage-create.sh.

Story: 2010236
Task: 46042
Change-Id: I1a0591de79be867483a044705e866b2368b2a567

revisions:

This spec proposes to use the os-extend_volume_completion volume action
that has been proposed for Cinder to provide feedback on success or
failure when handling volume-extended external server events.

A previous version of this spec proposed a new API in Nova, but is has

Change-Id: I1a59cd571dfcec814df09e208979a481d4ea43af
'}]
commit_message:
Use extend volume completion action

This spec proposes to use the os-extend_volume_completion volume action
that has been proposed for Cinder to provide feedback on success or
failure when handling volume-extended external server events.

A previous version of this spec proposed a new API in Nova, but is has
since been rewritten completely.
The old version can be found in Patchset 6 and earlier.

Blueprint: assisted-volume-extend
Change-Id: I1a59cd571dfcec814df09e208979a481d4ea43af

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2023-01-03 02:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovn/metadata/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovn/metadata/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Improve agent provision performance for large networks

Before this patch, the metadata agent would provision network namespace
for all subnets under a network(datapath) as soon as the first
VM(vif port) was mounted on the chassis. This operation can take very
long time for networks with lots of subnets. See the linked bug for
more details.
This patch changes this mechanism to "lazy load" where metadata agent
provisions metadata namespace with only the subnets belonging to the
active ports on the chassis. This results in virtually constant
throughput not effected by the number of subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1981113
Change-Id: Ia2a66cfd3fd1380c5204109742d44f09160548d2
'}]
commit_message:
Improve agent provision performance for large networks

Before this patch, the metadata agent would provision network namespace
for all subnets under a network(datapath) as soon as the first
VM(vif port) was mounted on the chassis. This operation can take very
long time for networks with lots of subnets. See the linked bug for
more details.
This patch changes this mechanism to "lazy load" where metadata agent
provisions metadata namespace with only the subnets belonging to the
active ports on the chassis. This results in virtually constant
throughput not effected by the number of subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1981113
Change-Id: Ia2a66cfd3fd1380c5204109742d44f09160548d2

subject: Review usage of oslo-privsep library on Nova
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2023-01-11 14:47:09.000000000', 'files': ['specs/2023.1/approved/privsep-usage-review.rst'], 'message': "Review usage of oslo-privsep library on Nova

Nova's usage of the privsep library is too broad. A single global permission
profile with all needed capabilities is defined for all functions that interact
with privsep to use. While this works, it is not the best usage of the library
as functions are getting a set of rights they do not need and thus should not
receive. This spec seeks to fix this situation by defining a more specialized
usage of the library.

Change-Id: I713ddd60275f29f4361a4c6e93b7299f1d31aa85
"}]
commit_message:
Review usage of oslo-privsep library on Nova

Nova's usage of the privsep library is too broad. A single global permission
profile with all needed capabilities is defined for all functions that interact
with privsep to use. While this works, it is not the best usage of the library
as functions are getting a set of rights they do not need and thus should not
receive. This spec seeks to fix this situation by defining a more specialized
usage of the library.

Change-Id: I713ddd60275f29f4361a4c6e93b7299f1d31aa85

Project and user names would be first fetched from cache, if not found,

significanlty reduce the number of calls made to keystone.

If ceilometer is configured with no caching backend, the results
will always be fetched by querying request to keystone.

A new config option, `tenant_name_discovery` is introduced
to operate this feature. This feature is optional and is disabled by default.

No attempts to identify names will be made if uuids are found to be `None`.

Change-Id: Iee5dbf09a1fd3ac571746fc66d2683eb8e6a1b27

commit_message:
Add user/project names to polled samples

Project and user names would be first fetched from cache, if not found,
they will be requested from keystone and then cached. Using cache will
significanlty reduce the number of calls made to keystone.

If ceilometer is configured with no caching backend, the results
will always be fetched by querying request to keystone.

A new config option, `tenant_name_discovery` is introduced
to operate this feature. This feature is optional and is disabled by default.

No attempts to identify names will be made if uuids are found to be `None`.

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iee5dbf09a1fd3ac571746fc66d2683eb8e6a1b27
(cherry picked from commit 79454d6b22787627ae6239aa7b2707101ba30212)

subject: Make tox.ini tox 4.0 compatible
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2023-01-06 16:32:11.000000000', 'files': ['doc/requirements.txt', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Make tox.ini tox 4.0 compatible

* use min version 4.2.5, for fixes [1][2][3]
* passenv fixed as space-separated list is not allowed anymore
* dock target uses requirements from requirements.txt as well as
  doc/requirements.txt
* skipsdist is not supported
* whitelist_externals has been removed in favour of allowlist_externals

* reno was added to doc/requirements.txt to fix the releasenotes target
* update setup.cfg to install aodh from tarball in the requirements
  The tarball wasn't being installed when specified in tox.ini, and the
  [extras] section in setup.cfg needed updating to support installing
  from a URL

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/2754
[2] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/2824
[3] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/2828

Change-Id: I4122d0d05f297f864318e80392e6c77fb2e9fdcf
"}]
commit_message:
Make tox.ini tox 4.0 compatible

* use min version 4.2.5, for fixes [1][2][3]
* passenv fixed as space-separated list is not allowed anymore
* dock target uses requirements from requirements.txt as well as
  doc/requirements.txt
* skipsdist is not supported
* whitelist_externals has been removed in favour of allowlist_externals

* reno was added to doc/requirements.txt to fix the releasenotes target
* update setup.cfg to install aodh from tarball in the requirements
  The tarball wasn't being installed when specified in tox.ini, and the
  [extras] section in setup.cfg needed updating to support installing
  from a URL

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/2754
[2] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/2824
[3] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/2828

Change-Id: I4122d0d05f297f864318e80392e6c77fb2e9fdcf

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Support an array value for pure_iscsi_cidr_list

The pure_iscsi_cidr_list parameter is a ListOpt and accepts a comma-
separated list.

can more easily compose the value in manifests.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-10 10:18:15.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Update branches: for tripleo-ci-centos-8-standalone

In [1] we removed the c8 jobs from running on stable/wallaby
(keeping only a subset ffu/mixed-rhel jobs).

However the standalone-upgrade-ffu job is parenting from
c8-standalone and the branches: match here is too restrictive
preventing the ffu-standalone from running in wallaby. This
re-adds wallaby into branches for that parent job.

Change-Id: I71734ea9711c9d14f51e26254ec9964aa22df060
'}]
commit_message:
Update branches: for tripleo-ci-centos-8-standalone

In [1] we removed the c8 jobs from running on stable/wallaby
(keeping only a subset ffu/mixed-rhel jobs).

However the standalone-upgrade-ffu job is parenting from
c8-standalone and the branches: match here is too restrictive
preventing the ffu-standalone from running in wallaby. This
re-adds wallaby into branches for that parent job.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/867351

Change-Id: I71734ea9711c9d14f51e26254ec9964aa22df060

commit_message:
Remove trunk.registry from tripleo-ci repo

trunk.registry.rdoproject.org going to decomission
soon. This patch remove trunk.registry from
tripleo-ci repo.

This patch also removes Dockerfile_rhui.j2 template,
which is used internally. No need to keep it in the
upstream.

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I11bc7cc37af6271fac7c651c8598a741cf0af783

subject: host puppet: Do not fail until debug output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-29 01:45:26.000000000', 'files': ['common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml'], 'message': "host puppet: Do not fail until debug output

Currently we have the debug task to dump output of the puppet run for
host configuration, but the task is not executed in case puppet fails.
This makes troubleshooting quite difficult because we don't have well-
formatted output in case of failures.

This ensures the debug task is executed, and ansible fails AFTER debug
output is shown.

Because we have the separate debug task, the output from the initial
puppet execution can be hidden.

Change-Id: I270eb553d4b2f001781d02d7639b7957cbbab99f
"}]
commit_message:
host puppet: Do not fail until debug output

Currently we have the debug task to dump output of the puppet run for
host configuration, but the task is not executed in case puppet fails.
This makes troubleshooting quite difficult because we don't have well-
formatted output in case of failures.

This ensures the debug task is executed, and ansible fails AFTER debug
output is shown.

Because we have the separate debug task, the output from the initial
puppet execution can be hidden.

Change-Id: I270eb553d4b2f001781d02d7639b7957cbbab99f

commit_message:
Use standard home directory for outputs

This change ensures the home directory is used to output files for
standalone deployment and config export.

Previously the output directory is affected by undercloud.conf but
this config file is for undercloud installation and is not meant to
affect the other commands.

This allows us to avoid loading config file when defining constants.

Change-Id: I04426219a975a2dcfc593faa08c2de8b7af661ae

Since [1] was merged, hostnames, instead of ips, are used to connect
memcache. Thus memcache_node_names should be exported in addition to
memcache_node_ips. Currently memcache_node_ips is still used by
Horizon[2], thus it is still kept in the exported data.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/796832
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/812349

Change-Id: I10c6a26ba3ca161d38cd98b1b8d33c31dc68372c
'}]
commit_message:
Export memcache node names in addition to ips

Since [1] was merged, hostnames, instead of ips, are used to connect
memcache. Thus memcache_node_names should be exported in addition to
memcache_node_ips. Currently memcache_node_ips is still used by
Horizon[2], thus it is still kept in the exported data.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/796832
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/812349

Change-Id: I10c6a26ba3ca161d38cd98b1b8d33c31dc68372c

Note that the parameters updated by this change are all set by tht

commit_message:
Remove reference to unused hieradata keys

Currently some parameters use specific hierata keys to pick up values
but these hierata keys are not used by tht. This change removes such
unnecessary usage to reduce amount of hiera look up.

Note that the parameters updated by this change are all set by tht
parameters(or are hardcoded). Thus we don't expect any user would try
overriding these parameters using hieradata key, instead of template
parameters.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/831778
Change-Id: I5b84c9a6015e9f1b097331d1c4a48d35e39eedfa

subject: Gnocchi: Ensure NFS mount is ready
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-12-06 14:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/gnocchi/gnocchi-statsd-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/gnocchi/gnocchi-metricd-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/gnocchi/gnocchi-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Gnocchi: Ensure NFS mount is ready

This change adds additional systemd dependency so that Gnocchi services
are started after its backend NFS filesystem is ready. Otherwise
the services can start without access to NFS and use host filesystem
which results in unexpected behavior.

Because current TripleO supports customizing the mount point for NFS
backend, we use the global remote-fs.target instead of the speficic
*.mount .

Change-Id: I09470cd5802b4d652a495e15e08c4cf065a20f6a
'}]
commit_message:
Gnocchi: Ensure NFS mount is ready

This change adds additional systemd dependency so that Gnocchi services
are started after its backend NFS filesystem is ready. Otherwise
the services can start without access to NFS and use host filesystem
which results in unexpected behavior.

Because current TripleO supports customizing the mount point for NFS
backend, we use the global remote-fs.target instead of the speficic
*.mount .

Change-Id: I09470cd5802b4d652a495e15e08c4cf065a20f6a

This is follow-up of ad6bc22f217929a78ba2a9dada036b176d2717ed and

The NovaLibvirtCommon resource is not shared but is used only by
the resource template for modular libvirt services.

This change squashed that redundant resource to the modular libvirt
service template, so that we can reduce number of resources and

Change-Id: I8c4fc827aa32f97ae79f52001a3e02c711c9ec83

commit_message:
Nova: Squash NovaLibvirtCommon resource

The NovaLibvirtCommon resource is not shared but is used only by
the resource template for modular libvirt services.

This change squashed that redundant resource to the modular libvirt
service template, so that we can reduce number of resources and
templates we maintain.

Change-Id: I8c4fc827aa32f97ae79f52001a3e02c711c9ec83

commit_message:
Nova: refactor redundant logic to determine live_migration_inbound_addr

The live_migration_inbound_addr pameter is always set consistently
regardless of the use of tls for migration, thus can be defined in
the common place instead of duplicating the same value in if-else
block.

Change-Id: Ic3f52dec73dd78b9f18b069cf672b68faf99798c

subject: Neutron: Fix description of comma_delimited_list parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-24 08:21:15.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/neutron/neutron-base.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-l3-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-ovs-agent-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-sriov-agent-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/neutron/neutron-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Neutron: Fix description of comma_delimited_list parameters

The parameters defined with the comma_delimited_list type accept not
only comma-separated list strings ('a,b,c') but also native lists
(['a', 'b', 'c']).

This change drops the explicit mentons of "comma-separated list"
because it's not mandatory and users can use the native list format.

Change-Id: I1e10b740c95b16061f0e8ec33243da2bd5164895
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Fix description of comma_delimited_list parameters

The parameters defined with the comma_delimited_list type accept not
only comma-separated list strings ('a,b,c') but also native lists
(['a', 'b', 'c']).

This change drops the explicit mentons of "comma-separated list"
because it's not mandatory and users can use the native list format.

Change-Id: I1e10b740c95b16061f0e8ec33243da2bd5164895

commit_message:
Drop environments/services-baremetal

This directory was initially created[1] to store environment files to
enable baremetal services, but the actual files in the directory
enables containers.

Because current TripleO no longer supports baremetal services and
similar environment files exist in the different directories
(environments/service or environments), this removes the confusing
directory.

[1] 882fb2a89697b175d9e6043f1da37ecc3efd92c9

Change-Id: Ie17aa4117d379a34a25444b4a9a3702d4a1d5f70

subject: NetApp volume driver: Use different shares config file per backend
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2022-09-06 05:20:44.000000000', 'files': ['spec/fixtures/hieradata/step5.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/cinder/volume/netapp.pp', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_cinder_volume_netapp_spec.rb'], 'message': 'NetApp volume driver: Use different shares config file per backend

... to avoid conflicts when multiple backends are used. Previously
users always need to set the CinderNetappNfsSharesConfig parameter to
avoid multiple backends from using the same share file. However this
requirement is redundant and causes the duplicate resource declaration
in puppet, which is usually unclear to users.

This also allows us to avoid conflict with NFS backend, which uses
the same config file (/etc/cinder/shares.conf) by default.

Change-Id: I8b4a179a1122191fae73db4da1c7ec72d55f5065
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp volume driver: Use different shares config file per backend

... to avoid conflicts when multiple backends are used. Previously
users always need to set the CinderNetappNfsSharesConfig parameter to
avoid multiple backends from using the same share file. However this
requirement is redundant and causes the duplicate resource declaration
in puppet, which is usually unclear to users.

This also allows us to avoid conflict with NFS backend, which uses
the same config file (/etc/cinder/shares.conf) by default.

Change-Id: I8b4a179a1122191fae73db4da1c7ec72d55f5065

commit_message:
Swift: Deprecate deployment for dispersion tool

This feature prepares a few resources so that users can run
the swift-dispersion report easily, but it is not required by
the core functionality of swift.

The feature still requires that the swift package is installed in host
instead of containers.

Change-Id: I8d552ab2a44ed12e53187e22a54e74ef06c5a421

commit_message:
Drop incomplete implementation to deploy netcontrold

Support for netcontrold was added by [1] but it has never been
completed. The change to build the container image for this service[2]
was abandoned without any alternative solution.

Because feature has never been implemented completely, this removes
the useless and unmaintained implementation.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/694765
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/695626

subject: Remove unused arguments of _heat_deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-20 04:24:39.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused arguments of _heat_deploy

The following arguments of the _heat_deploy method are not used.
 - run_validations
 - roles_file
 - deployment_options

This change removes these arguments and also a few unused arguments
from the other methods calling it.

Also, it seems the --run-validation option has had no effect. This
removes reference to that option and deprecate it officially, so that
we can remove it in a future release.

Change-Id: Ia31ef4ff785aa75ea6c7d7f2f4a8eaadfb397ba4
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused arguments of _heat_deploy

The following arguments of the _heat_deploy method are not used.
 - run_validations
 - roles_file
 - deployment_options

This change removes these arguments and also a few unused arguments
from the other methods calling it.

Also, it seems the --run-validation option has had no effect. This
removes reference to that option and deprecate it officially, so that
we can remove it in a future release.

Change-Id: Ia31ef4ff785aa75ea6c7d7f2f4a8eaadfb397ba4

subject: Use native plugin to manage security group resources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-19 08:53:09.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/octavia_overcloud_config/tasks/network.yml'], 'message': 'Use native plugin to manage security group resources

We already use the ansible plugin to manage security group rules for
log forwarding, so using it globally would make implementation simpler
than using both shell + the ansible plugin.

Also, the security groups are now created in the project consistent
with the security group rules.

Change-Id: I90b100728a1a516b0640ceb890fd3a234246a96a
'}]
commit_message:
Use native plugin to manage security group resources

We already use the ansible plugin to manage security group rules for
log forwarding, so using it globally would make implementation simpler
than using both shell + the ansible plugin.

Also, the security groups are now created in the project consistent
with the security group rules.

Change-Id: I90b100728a1a516b0640ceb890fd3a234246a96a

commit_message:
container_puppet_config: Merge volumes correctly

This change fixes the wrong handling of "volumes" key in puppet_config,
to avoid failure if there are multiple puppet_config definitions with
the same config_volume but different sets of volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1980905
Change-Id: I0e1fd858f3548b72d07a067db9e221eae3c77823
(cherry picked from commit 5aed143349c351de067fa9f314f2a292ef523131)

subject: Fix ignored RsyslogExtraLoggingSource
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-07-13 00:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/logging/rsyslog-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Fix ignored RsyslogExtraLoggingSource

The RsyslogExtraLoggingSource parameter, which was added by [1], has
had no effect because of the missing top-level service name under
the service_config_settings key.

Also the parameter is used by the rsyslog service so it's not really
required to use the service_config_settings, which is used to pass
puppet parameters to a different service.

[1] a1b967fafefb1df39e9e04fae0476b14063dfff4

Change-Id: Icfee4a052fdea1851d2d97e4ae9a8324561abab3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ignored RsyslogExtraLoggingSource

The RsyslogExtraLoggingSource parameter, which was added by [1], has
had no effect because of the missing top-level service name under
the service_config_settings key.

Also the parameter is used by the rsyslog service so it's not really
required to use the service_config_settings, which is used to pass
puppet parameters to a different service.

[1] a1b967fafefb1df39e9e04fae0476b14063dfff4

Change-Id: Icfee4a052fdea1851d2d97e4ae9a8324561abab3

subject: Glance: Test backend classes with api class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-01-26 23:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_glance_backend_file_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_glance_backend_swift_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_glance_backend_rbd_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_glance_backend_cinder_spec.rb'], 'message': "Glance: Test backend classes with api class

The tripleo::profile::base::glance::backend::* are designed to be used
together with the tripleo::profile::base::glance::api class.
This change ensures the backend classes are tested with the api class
included. This solves the following error we see after the change
4b4d7d9a5a9a1654dd9b59891f934cfac75501a0 was merged to puppet-glance.

Could not find resource 'Service[glance-api]' for relationship from
'Anchor[swift::service::end]'

Change-Id: Ie8c7a7c7b092f501bfc7f4fd3d45b5a6118fcf50
"}]
commit_message:
Glance: Test backend classes with api class

The tripleo::profile::base::glance::backend::* are designed to be used
together with the tripleo::profile::base::glance::api class.
This change ensures the backend classes are tested with the api class
included. This solves the following error we see after the change
4b4d7d9a5a9a1654dd9b59891f934cfac75501a0 was merged to puppet-glance.

Could not find resource 'Service[glance-api]' for relationship from
'Anchor[swift::service::end]'

Change-Id: Ie8c7a7c7b092f501bfc7f4fd3d45b5a6118fcf50

commit_message:
Get rid of RemovalPoliciesMode

Since we switched to ephemeral heat, overcloud stack is always created
from scratch, so we no longer append RemovalPolicies but always update
it.

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2023-01-05 14:45:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_snat_ns.py'], 'message': "Set ip_nonlocal_bind to 1 for HA routers and DVR snat

Set nonlocal_bind to 1 to allow starting applications in both
routers (like ipsec from vpnaas). nonlocal_bin 0 prevens us from
starting ipsec in both routers simulteniously as process can't bind
to non existing address which was worarkunded in [1]
by setting dependency on python process during failover.

This revert [2] completely, which was partially reverted by [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/823904
[2] https://review.opendev.org/393886
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/752360

Change-Id: I18a15aa3ca745b2b794610350f538d02575ccbe0
"}]
commit_message:
Set ip_nonlocal_bind to 1 for HA routers and DVR snat

Set nonlocal_bind to 1 to allow starting applications in both
routers (like ipsec from vpnaas). nonlocal_bin 0 prevens us from
starting ipsec in both routers simulteniously as process can't bind
to non existing address which was worarkunded in [1]
by setting dependency on python process during failover.

This revert [2] completely, which was partially reverted by [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/823904
[2] https://review.opendev.org/393886
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/752360

Related-Bug: 1999761

Change-Id: I18a15aa3ca745b2b794610350f538d02575ccbe0

subject: Do not sudo stat Ceph spec file on Ansible host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-11 15:06:57.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/tasks/pre.yaml'], 'message': 'Do not sudo stat Ceph spec file on Ansible host

When the "Stat spec file on ansible host" task is run
from an Ansible runner container, the task fails with:

"module_stderr": "/bin/sh: line 1: sudo: command not found\n",

This patch removes "become: true" so that the task
no longer fails under these conditions.

It shouldn't be necessary to use sudo to stat this
file on a standard undercloud or in an Ansible runner
container. There are other tasks which use become
and other tasks which delegate to localhost, but
this task in the tripleo_cephadm role which uses both.

Change-Id: I1aab213206d32ffae2f9fea92970a4bf13801f16
(cherry picked from commit 6c94f7e7f3fb84917021a4c2654ac6779607a84f)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not sudo stat Ceph spec file on Ansible host

When the "Stat spec file on ansible host" task is run
from an Ansible runner container, the task fails with:

"module_stderr": "/bin/sh: line 1: sudo: command not found\n",

This patch removes "become: true" so that the task
no longer fails under these conditions.

It shouldn't be necessary to use sudo to stat this
file on a standard undercloud or in an Ansible runner
container. There are other tasks which use become
and other tasks which delegate to localhost, but
this task in the tripleo_cephadm role which uses both.

Change-Id: I1aab213206d32ffae2f9fea92970a4bf13801f16
(cherry picked from commit 6c94f7e7f3fb84917021a4c2654ac6779607a84f)

subject: Support same host resize with PCI in placement
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2022-12-21 15:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_pci_in_placement.py', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_pci_sriov_servers.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Support same host resize with PCI in placement

Id02e445c55fc956965b7d725f0260876d42422f2 added special case in the
healing logic for same host resize. Now that the scheduler also creates
allocation on the destination host during resize we need to make sure
that the drop_move_claim code that runs during revert and confirm drops
the tracked migration from the resource tracker only after the healing
logic run as these migrations being confirmed / reverted are still
affecting PciDevices at this point.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I6241965fe6c1cc1f2560fcce65d5e32ef308d502
'}]
commit_message:
Support same host resize with PCI in placement

Id02e445c55fc956965b7d725f0260876d42422f2 added special case in the
healing logic for same host resize. Now that the scheduler also creates
allocation on the destination host during resize we need to make sure
that the drop_move_claim code that runs during revert and confirm drops
the tracked migration from the resource tracker only after the healing
logic run as these migrations being confirmed / reverted are still
affecting PciDevices at this point.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I6241965fe6c1cc1f2560fcce65d5e32ef308d502

subject: Prevent bootstrap failure when all roles/collections are overriden
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-11 10:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'scripts/get-ansible-collection-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Prevent bootstrap failure when all roles/collections are overriden

At the moment we assume that scenario when all roles or collections
provided by ansible-role/collection-requirements won't be overwritten.
As if they do, previous set_fact will be skipped and
galaxy_collections_list/clone_roles will remain undefined.

To avoid failure and to allow to fully override roles/collections we
define default for the task that aims to merge default items with
user-provided ones.

Change-Id: I86d44499073f0571a529d81ed3be713996e5f339
(cherry picked from commit 63363abdbf094f4fc0a5f52412661563b6bede36)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent bootstrap failure when all roles/collections are overriden

At the moment we assume that scenario when all roles or collections
provided by ansible-role/collection-requirements won't be overwritten.
As if they do, previous set_fact will be skipped and
galaxy_collections_list/clone_roles will remain undefined.

To avoid failure and to allow to fully override roles/collections we
define default for the task that aims to merge default items with
user-provided ones.

Change-Id: I86d44499073f0571a529d81ed3be713996e5f339
(cherry picked from commit 63363abdbf094f4fc0a5f52412661563b6bede36)

subject: Fix dict object key error when haproxy interfaces not defined
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-11 11:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['templates/service.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': "Fix dict object key error when haproxy interfaces not defined

The ternary options appear to be getting evaluated whether they
are used or not, so item['interface'] is always accessed.

This patch aims to check for the key's presence before performing
ternary operations, or use Ansible variables to postpone evaluation
until absolutely necessary.

Change-Id: Ib1462c04d1a0820a37998f989e2ed16566f71f54
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dict object key error when haproxy interfaces not defined

The ternary options appear to be getting evaluated whether they
are used or not, so item['interface'] is always accessed.

This patch aims to check for the key's presence before performing
ternary operations, or use Ansible variables to postpone evaluation
until absolutely necessary.

Change-Id: Ib1462c04d1a0820a37998f989e2ed16566f71f54

commit_message:
Handle omitted variables which appear as empty strings

Changes to external roles cause some variables to be passed in
as empty strings which result in invalid config and InvalidArgument
errors.

This could be addressed here or in the calling role.

Change-Id: Iee71e9839d4c8d318c2c36152d966dd5a1b88111

commit_message:
setup.py: Remove 'py_modules'

This was merely obscuring a bug in pbr. setuptools doesn't do the
auto-discovery when pbr is in use. Remove it.

Also fixes the environments list where it is now validated for what is
installed by removing functional-py38, and fixing the job to just be
"functional".

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/pbr/+/869082
Change-Id: Ife999840777f3c553f569d81cd826ef9d5a6765d

commit_message:
[Octavia] Create a rsyslog forward when *_log_targets params are set

If a user sets the OctaviaAdminLogTargets param or the
OctaviaTenantLogTargets param (from [0]), the
octavia_controller_post_config role now creates a rsyslog forwarder on
the controllers, that redirects messages to those targets.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/857600

Change-Id: I994bd597d0425a4cd5988f7570eaacc300b6b2e4

commit_message:
Rotate cephadm_command.log

Before calling cephadm playbook, check if the log file
cephadm_command.log exists (from a previous run).
If it does, then rename it to append a timestamp. When
cephadm is run, a new log will be created.

Change-Id: Ia0a2c46eb84e43c9c69fd5a087bfd4bcc687fd95
Resolves: rhbz#2149339
(cherry picked from commit 35155b9230398cb62f851623ac1b5b6bbd5ae186)

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-09-24 14:22:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Make raid clean steps configurable

This patch makes in-band RAID clean steps configurable
in the CONF file.  Even though claiming RAID for cleaning
needs other issues to be solved, making the priority of the
these clean step configurable helps someone who has homogenous
hardware all of which support RAID.

It adds two new CONF variables [agent]create_raid_config_priority
and [agent]delete_raid_config_priority which defines priorities
for these in-band steps.  It also marks the feature as experimental

Implements: blueprint inband-raid-configuration
Change-Id: I4cb67e6807f2853e696a893ecf311b2e032669be
'}]
commit_message:
Make raid clean steps configurable

This patch makes in-band RAID clean steps configurable
in the CONF file.  Even though claiming RAID for cleaning
needs other issues to be solved, making the priority of the
these clean step configurable helps someone who has homogenous
hardware all of which support RAID.

It adds two new CONF variables [agent]create_raid_config_priority
and [agent]delete_raid_config_priority which defines priorities
for these in-band steps.  It also marks the feature as experimental
in the description of CONF variables.

Implements: blueprint inband-raid-configuration
Change-Id: I4cb67e6807f2853e696a893ecf311b2e032669be

commit_message:
Replace rootwrap_config with root_helper config

The execute() command is duplicated in ironic and ironic-lib.
This removes ironic's execute() and changes ironic to use
ironic-lib's execute().

To do this means deprecating ironic's rootwrap_config configuration
option (slated for removal in Ocata), and using
[ironic-lib]root_helper config option instead. A warning will be
logged if rootwrap_config was set to a non-default value.
The root_helper configuration option is different from
rootwrap_config but can be derived from rootwrap_config.

Change-Id: Icc9b0fbd7e97608a380aef902921f4394d728711
Closes-Bug: #1525795

commit_message:
Allow plus sign in flavor ids

The flavor id is a string that allowed the minus sign but not the
plus sign. This fixes it so that plus signs can be used in flavor
ids.

Closes-Bug: #1920938

Change-Id: I1cf9f05f019e29bdda0cf64440094884edf79279

subject: When pxe-booting, try to set boot device
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-21 16:08:42.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_base.py'], 'message': "When pxe-booting, try to set boot device

When pxe-booting, try to set the boot device. Setting the
boot device could result in an IPMI failure -- we don't
want that to cause a failure in the pxe-booting process.

When retrying a pxe boot, modify the log to indicate what
provision state the ironic node is in. The data gathered
could be useful for tweaking the option settings like the
[pxe]boot_retry_timeout value.

Change-Id: I2aa3cbc4b9fa33ad8cf84d1a782ea1fbd14cd5b1
"}]
commit_message:
When pxe-booting, try to set boot device

When pxe-booting, try to set the boot device. Setting the
boot device could result in an IPMI failure -- we don't
want that to cause a failure in the pxe-booting process.

When retrying a pxe boot, modify the log to indicate what
provision state the ironic node is in. The data gathered
could be useful for tweaking the option settings like the
[pxe]boot_retry_timeout value.

Change-Id: I2aa3cbc4b9fa33ad8cf84d1a782ea1fbd14cd5b1

commit_message:
Run security group scenario tests against stateless security groups too

With this patch all relevant scenario tests related to Security groups will be
run for the default (stateful) security groups and also for stateless
security groups by passing "stateful=False" to the
create_security_group() function.

Change-Id: I0bca93e9eac311978ef65c15af5ea793e2164631

commit_message:
Define libvirt secrets from keyring files in ceph_extra_confs

Previously this required always access to the mon_host of the Ceph
cluster to fetch the key for volume access. Now this key can be defined
through Ceph keyring files.

Change-Id: Ib2c755d38038b14ca3803de1bb9cbcec122eaa83

commit_message:
Rename Context to RequestContext

If castellan is used, it requires one of the following context types to
be provided during init: KeystonePassword, KeystoneToken or
RequestContext [1]

Also it makes sense to be consistent across projects and with
oslo_context regarding context class naming.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/castellan/src/commit/86712360f345866e108e12eda1075101635dd1ec/castellan/key_manager/barbican_key_manager.py#L208-L210

Change-Id: Ic08ad89b4e07e0fe8a80b3e5db6d50276aafff82
